commit_message:
Add '*.pyc' clean up for unit_tests

After updating code from actual branch we still use old *.pyc files.
It can give an unexpected result, for instance, a lot of tests are
broken due to unknown reasons.
This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I3bdbad9748dc3d94d6d8914156604eab7ad877a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/69/481569/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: findcommands = find . -type f -name "*.pyc" -delete bash {toxinidir}/tools/unit_tests.sh {envpython} {toxinidir} {posargs}

commit_message:
Removed nonexistent option from quickstart snippet

Neither `ironic-api` nor `ironic-conductor` tools accept
the `-v` option. Although the developer's quickstart guide
has it in the example what makes cut&paste failing.

This quick fix removes the offending option from the doc.

Change-Id: I31e3657f12f7a9cf64697b362cc168333752184c

commit_message:
Adjust stringified dates to the local timezone

Fetch local timezone from session variable 'django_timezone'. This
setting can be either set in Horizon manually or it defaults to the
value of setting TIME_ZONE (with 'UTC' value as a default).

Change-Id: I6c0bbf7b0e0763bd238ab9fa9c4c75e3fdf02fbd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/05/480605/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import iso8601import pytzdef adjust_datestr(request, datestr): tz = pytz.timezone(request.session.get('django_timezone')) dt = iso8601.parse_date(datestr).astimezone(tz) return dt.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') result += adjust_datestr(request, report.created) + ' - ' + \ return adjust_datestr(request, deployment.started)

commit_message:
Creates warning for key not found on delete

When deleting the key for barbican currently an exception is being
raised in the case where the key does not exist. This is not required
and can simply be handled with a warning.

Change-Id: I0324d211dd407ce141de95a1e834b787ff958b93
Fixes-bug: #1631305

commit_message:
Adding tests affected by lp bug 1702257 to skip list

This patch add the following tests in to skip list:

* tempest.scenario.test_security_groups_basic_ops.TestSecurityGroupsBasicOps.test_in_tenant_traffic
* tempest.scenario.test_network_v6.TestGettingAddress.test_dhcp6_stateless_from_os
* tempest.scenario.test_network_v6.TestGettingAddress.test_dualnet_dhcp6_stateless_from_os
* tempest.scenario.test_minimum_basic.TestMinimumBasicScenario.test_minimum_basic_scenario
* tempest.scenario.test_network_v6.TestGettingAddress.test_dualnet_multi_prefix_dhcpv6_stateless
* tempest.scenario.test_volume_boot_pattern.TestVolumeBootPattern.test_volume_boot_pattern
* tempest.scenario.test_network_v6.TestGettingAddress.test_dualnet_multi_prefix_slaac
* tempest.scenario.test_network_v6.TestGettingAddress.test_multi_prefix_slaac
* tempest.scenario.test_security_groups_basic_ops.TestSecurityGroupsBasicOps.test_port_security_disable_security_group
* tempest.scenario.test_security_groups_basic_ops.TestSecurityGroupsBasicOps.test_port_update_new_security_group

Change-Id: I501f05d4e3aa2f066450fd0c455b5764c18fc245

commit_message:
Fix KeyError for HORIZON_CONFIG['plugins'] in plugin UT

HORIZON_CONFIG['plugins'] does not always exist.
It breaks unit tests of some horizon plugins like designate-dashboard.

Change-Id: I23aae10a7e63494c1c9f656b47becd2f067c9058
Closes-Bug: #1702889

commit_message:
use service type constants from neutron_lib plugins

The well known service type constants are in
neutron_lib.plugins.constants, but for legacy reasons a few still exist
and are referenced from neutron_lib.constants [1] that we'd like to
remove.

This patch switches references over to neutron_lib's plugin constants.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/master/neutron_lib/constants.py#L353

Change-Id: Ieb3c5890dfba91eff6227c481cd960db3c9da6d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/79/478279/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib.plugins import constants as plugin_constants l3_plugin = directory.get_plugin(plugin_constants.L3)

commit_message:
Fix environment.d path for ironic-agent-multipath

Due to an unclean backport, the directory ended being
at root level, placing that properly.

Fixes backport: Ieda51d71c4760c66c00c48d27b6b6b66e3f479eb

Change-Id: I15043b2d2df136912672cd5adfd97b3f3b915e4a

commit_message:
Add 'protected' filter to image-list call

Implements v2 API image-list filtering on the 'protected' property
following the spec:
https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/glance-specs/tree/specs/pike
/approved/glance/add-protected-filter.rst
The 'protected' query string parameter accepts one of 'true', 'false'.
Any other value raises a 400 with an appropriate message.
See the discussion on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/451560/
for why this implementation strategy was chosen.

Change-Id: Ie90d952edddd3f69b3f489f056ff506e63f96376
Closes-Bug: #1674246

added_lines: protected = filters.pop('protected', None) if protected is not None: # change the type of protected from string to boolean if protected in ('true', 'True', True): filters['protected'] = True elif protected in ('false', 'False', False): filters['protected'] = False else: pass

commit_message:
Unity: unexpected data in share from snapshot

The share created from snapshot had inconsistent data with the snapshot,
but consistent with the original share. Because the snapshot was
created on wrong `storage resource`.

Change-Id: Ia135c93bd9eedaba549426ea9233a90767de5d46
Closes-bug: 1701458

commit_message:
Added spec for high availability testing

Change-Id: Iee7538db9bf9dbce01ff5caf597b9dba03a25ec4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qa-specs refs/changes/18/399618/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. ================================ Stepler Test Framework ================================ During the OpenStack summit in Barcelona we discussed not covered area for OpenStack clouds testing: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/ocata-qa-destructive-testing We need to create a new framework which is not intended for OpenStack API validation, but provides simple tool for creation tests to check destructive scenarios which will check High Availability, failover and recovery testing of OpenStack clusters. Problem description =================== We need to test High Availability of OpenStack services and check how OpenStack services will work in case of any destructive scenarios. Such tests allow to verify that OpenStack cluster will stay alive in case of any destructive scenarios (like shutdown of nodes, restart of network switches, restart of some OpenStack services, DB / RabbitMQ downtime and etc). What we want to check and cover with these tests: - How Openstack cluster behaves in case of some destructive scenarios? - Will the cluster alive if we lose some nodes / services? - Check the proper work of auto-healing scripts / pacemaker / OCF and etc. - Verify some OpenStack features which require shutdown / restart of nodes / services. Proposed change =============== Add new repository with framework to provide High Availability, destructive, failover, and recovery testing. Add test cases based on its framework. Implementation ============== The test solution (framework) architecture should be based on STEPS-methodology, that considers a test as a sequence of steps. Each of steps ends with it's own check, that step was finished correct. It allows to compose plenty of tests, having moderate codebase. This framework should use os-faults library to manage the nodes and networking switches (shutdown, run bash commands, restart services and etc.). Architecture should have the following abstraction levels of codebase (from higher to less): - clients are able to manipulate resources: users, roles, servers, etc. For ex: keystone client, nova client, node client, etc. - steps are actions, that we want to make over resources via clients: create, delete, update, migrate, etc. They should end with check, that step was finished correct. - fixtures manage resources construction, destruction, etc via steps. - tests combine steps and fixtures according to scenario. Assignee(s) ----------- * Timur Nurlygayanov (tnurlygayanov@mirantis.com) * Sergei Chipiga (schipiga@mirantis.com) Mandatory design reviewers: * Dina Belova (Mirantis, DinaBelova at IRC) * Luz Cazares (luzC at IRC) * Ken'ichi Ohmichi (oomichi at IRC) Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Ocata Q2 Work Items ---------- - Create the repository for the new framework - Create the core of the framework - Add destructive and failover test scenarios

subject: Include init_systemd taskfile once
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-06 14:24:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone/commit/ea14e41a849443ac13be1c0b480f9af3689b636a', 'message': 'Include init_systemd taskfile once

Instead of providing vars to and including the keystone_init_systemd for
each keystone uwsgi program, loop over those program names within the
tasks.

This also prevents the /etc/tmpfiles.d/keystone.conf file from being
overwritten twice on every run.

Change-Id: I00dc80db7f6672fb26af0ec2301b3a4ea451844d
(cherry picked from commit 1b8a085b79af78b3806744eae686086c2050e00c)

each keystone uwsgi program, loop over those program names within the
tasks.

This also prevents the /etc/tmpfiles.d/keystone.conf file from being
overwritten twice on every run.

Change-Id: I00dc80db7f6672fb26af0ec2301b3a4ea451844d

commit_message:
Include init_systemd taskfile once

Instead of providing vars to and including the keystone_init_systemd for
each keystone uwsgi program, loop over those program names within the
tasks.

This also prevents the /etc/tmpfiles.d/keystone.conf file from being
overwritten twice on every run.

Backport note:
This has been adapted to include the changes required
for upstart.

Change-Id: I00dc80db7f6672fb26af0ec2301b3a4ea451844d
(cherry picked from commit 1b8a085b79af78b3806744eae686086c2050e00c)

commit_message:
Stop using deprecated 'message' attribute in Exception

The 'message' attribute has been deprecated and removed
from Python3.
For more details, please check:
https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0352/

Change-Id: Iade2e225894b907c23e78d7506c9a72e7ce53681

commit_message:
Neutron API workers fix

THT was setting the api and rpc workers to '' by default. This is
causing Neutron to spawn 1:1, workers to core count. This commit fixes
the problem of neutorn spawning 1:1, with using the conditional that
is in Pike to ignore the unset value.

Change-Id: I741b01bf574662bd446b0823563928153b69f04b

commit_message:
Add deploy_server_id and bootstrap_node_id to inventory

These variables match those provided by the heat-config hook when running
the ansible deploy steps in t-h-t, so adding them to the inventory will
enable also running the same tasks outside of heat in future, which may be
useful for manual upgrades and developer testing.

Change-Id: I433c9c1fad71d8713a74899268f19062ab368290
Depends-On: I2fc48eec77210805c0139fa4abcbf4dd721e7c37

commit_message:
vars: suse-42: Drop libgcc_s1 dependency

openSUSE provides multiple versions of gcc (and libgcc) and the
correct variant of libgcc is always pulled in when we install
'gcc'. As such, drop the explicit libgcc_s1 dependency and let
zypper pull the correct version for us.

Change-Id: If37d71c55f775a4996b97bf5806e274ce2f39c46
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server refs/changes/04/481104/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Limits the scheduler_hints additionalProperties to string and list
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-19 07:13:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_scheduler_hints.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/scheduler_hints.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/dbb01373903b8744a5c9ea66ac47622855337eb1', 'message': 'Limits the scheduler_hints additionalProperties to string and list

If you pass scheduler_hint's additional properties value as 'None',
as shown below, then create server API returns 500 error.

  '{"os:scheduler_hints": {"key": null}'

The RequestSpecs expects scheduler hints to be either of type string
or list(array). To fix this issue, restricted additional properties
to be string or list in schema, for other values it will return 400
error to the user.

Closes-Bug: #1682811
Change-Id: I1e7410e42562e135ac45f9cb3f002580b674d508
'}]
commit_message:
Limits the scheduler_hints additionalProperties to string and list

If you pass scheduler_hint's additional properties value as 'None',
as shown below, then create server API returns 500 error.

  '{"os:scheduler_hints": {"key": null}'

The RequestSpecs expects scheduler hints to be either of type string
or list(array). To fix this issue, restricted additional properties
to be string or list in schema, for other values it will return 400
error to the user.

Closes-Bug: #1682811
Change-Id: I1e7410e42562e135ac45f9cb3f002580b674d508
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/90/457890/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "additionalProperties": {"not": {"type": ["null", "object"]}}

commit_message:
vars: suse-42: Drop libgcc_s1 dependency

openSUSE provides multiple versions of gcc (and libgcc) and the
correct variant of libgcc is always pulled in when we install
'gcc'. As such, drop the explicit libgcc_s1 dependency and let
zypper pull the correct version for us.

Change-Id: Iafb3a6d6588f9667fc9cc464f24f40ef82f316da

commit_message:
Add .idea pattern to .gitignore

The .idea directoy is used by pycharm and should not be included
in the change list. The change extends the .gitignore file to
avoid .idea directory to be shown in the change list.

Change-Id: I31cf4180accb262cf7a851d9c6ed927c61bc9ca5

commit_message:
Use HAproxy config files copied by Kolla bootstrap

Make the HAProxy process read the configuration file that is
copied by Kolla bootstrap, rather than directly bind-mounting
the host config-data/haproxy/etc into /etc

With this change we aim at preventing keeping open files on
the host, so that updates to /var/lib/config-data won't break.

For this change to take effect, the haproxy_bundle puppet profile
must be changed as well in puppet-tripleo

Partial-Bug: #1698323

Change-Id: Ib14396d8e479dad84eb76300ae3c7e227f23c226

commit_message:
Cast the resulting intersect set into a list

When using Ansible with python3, the result of
the intersect filter is a set, not a list. This
causes a failure when trying to access item 0
in the list.

In this patch we cast the set to a list before
accessing item 0. This will work for both
python2 and python3.

Change-Id: I9b2a01882bfd5f02e0e0b85e1d57fab0fa88d0e9

commit_message:
Add 'networks' quota in quota sample files

'networks' quota can be available based on config value.
api-ref should show that for quota-set APIs and also sample files
so that it can be tested somewhere.

Also adding it to quota class APIs sample files also.
Closes-Bug: #1702201

Change-Id: I84d562a8ca10826dea4675d74669b5de64ff0ed0

commit_message:
mitaka-eol: Remove unused charm trusty jobs

charm repos do not have stable/mitaka branches - and neither have a
special branch role to run trusty jobs on other branches. Thus remove
all trusty jobs for them, they are completely unused.

Change-Id: I1b772a926673de5dfd98678fcdcb64ea10ffe8c1

commit_message:
Remove *_ssh drivers from all ironic jobs

as `*_ssh` drivers are about to be removed, use their `*_ipmitool`
counterparts everywhere.

commit_message:
Add os-service-types project

The API-WG recently defined the publication of data about the official
service types and their historical aliases. os-service-types is a
library to consume and encapsulate that data properly for anyone using
python.

Needed-By: I7621760d16c282c8671580e4f7be17ee1699e511
Change-Id: If63f602e1e8a4ce3867b99adef5a07c29aa44630

commit_message:
Standardize Keystone domain variables

As described here:
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/resource/core.py#L841
https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/keystone/conf/identity.py#L21

* default project domain name MUST be named 'Default'
* default project domain id MUST be named 'default'
* default project user name MUST be named 'Default'
* default project user id MUST be named 'default'

Change-Id: I610a0416647fdea31bb04889364da5395d8c8d74
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/87/479287/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: project_domain_name = {{ default_project_domain_name }}user_domain_name = {{ default_user_domain_name }}

subject: Use recommended function to setup auth middleware in devstack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-06-13 11:37:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/e3c6e86c6695e8bdfc2c6afd6653c78ed515c2f3', 'message': 'Use recommended function to setup auth middleware in devstack

Currently Mistral has own configuration for keystone
auth middleware. It's not desired behavior and
it's suggested to use recommended devstack configuration
function to prevent possible errors if something is
changed in keystone deployment.

This patch fixes this situation and implements official
"configure_auth_token_middleware" function support.

Change-Id: I884777826d6ed40d58f75ec5dfba93a876752dfe
Closes-bug: #1697662
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-14 23:41:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/fde066c13677b6fd168c91966e782617c60a64c5', 'message': 'Use recommended function to setup auth middleware in devstack

Currently Mistral has own configuration for keystone
auth middleware, many parameters of which are deprecated [1].
It's not desired behavior and it is suggested to use recommended
devstack configuration function to prevent possible errors if
something is changed in keystone deployment in the future.

This patch fixes this situation and implements official
"configure_auth_token_middleware" function support.

Also, now to create keystone client CONF.keystone_authtoken.auth_uri
is used, which is optional parameter. For this reason if "auth_uri"
is not set CONF.keystone_authtoken.auth_url will be used, because it is
mandatory parameter for all keystone identity plugins [2]:

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/blob/712438ebf9ee30d553f6b515e38b1c91a9ae498e/keystonemiddleware/auth_token/_auth.py#L29-L35
[2] https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/edeb84715c80c5299c0f78c872d6507d9093ad82/keystoneauth1/loading/identity.py#L37

Change-Id: I884777826d6ed40d58f75ec5dfba93a876752dfe
Closes-bug: #1697662
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-06-15 01:07:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/5265655611ec5fa51d0d7b9245f4e6300d88b9fc', 'message': 'Use recommended function to setup auth middleware in devstack

auth middleware, many parameters of which are deprecated [1].
It's not desired behavior and it is suggested to use recommended
devstack configuration function to prevent possible errors if

Also, now to create keystone client CONF.keystone_authtoken.auth_uri
is used, which is optional parameter. For this reason if "auth_uri"
is not set CONF.keystone_authtoken.auth_url will be used, because it is
mandatory parameter for all keystone identity plugins [2]:

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/blob/712438ebf9ee30d553f6b515e38b1c91a9ae498e/keystonemiddleware/auth_token/_auth.py#L29-L35
[2] https://github.com/openstack/keystoneauth/blob/edeb84715c80c5299c0f78c872d6507d9093ad82/keystoneauth1/loading/identity.py#L37

commit_message:
Use recommended function to setup auth middleware in devstack

Currently Mistral has own configuration for keystone
auth middleware, many parameters of which are deprecated [1].
It's not desired behavior and it is suggested to use recommended
devstack configuration function to prevent possible errors if
something is changed in keystone deployment in the future.

This patch fixes this situation and implements official
"configure_auth_token_middleware" function support.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/keystonemiddleware/blob/712438ebf9ee30d553f6b515e38b1c91a9ae498e/keystonemiddleware/auth_token/_auth.py#L29-L35

Change-Id: I884777826d6ed40d58f75ec5dfba93a876752dfe
Closes-bug: #1697662
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/96/473796/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: MISTRAL_AUTH_CACHE_DIR=${MISTRAL_AUTH_CACHE_DIR:-/var/cache/mistral}

commit_message:
Add fuel-plugin-ceph-multibackend

This plugin extends Fuel by allowing to deploy a
separate ceph pool(s) for different services (e.g. Glance).

Change-Id: I8fafee1b57115d4d1dbdab9fda4df956c0be2e12

commit_message:
Add fuel-plugin-emailnotifyd

This plugin enables Fuel to deploy emailnotifyd. This component
enables telemetry alerts to propagate via email.

Change-Id: Ia1651bf61f7c99e413725309f21b034d2e0ce791

commit_message:
Skip integration tests/non-doc jobs for certain patrole changes

Two types of skips are introduced:
  - All non-doc jobs should be skipped for doc-only Patrole changes
  - All integration jobs should be skipped for unit test-only
    Patrole changes

Simple changes to unit tests and docs should not trigger expensive
RBAC tests -- which are currently a battery of Tempest API tests
across 5 different jobs.

Change-Id: Id7ecdc1645636719cab211bdd8e413edf0fbcd2b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/73/478373/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Skip non-doc jobs for doc-only patrole changes. - name: ^gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole.*$ skip-if: - project: ^openstack/patrole.*$ all-files-match-any: - ^.*\.rst$ - ^doc/.* - ^releasenotes/.* # Skip integration jobs for unit test-only patrole changes. - name: ^gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole.*$ skip-if: - project: ^openstack/patrole.*$ all-files-match-any: - ^patrole.patrole_tempest_plugin.tests.unit.*$

Remove obsolete python34-jobs

python34 jobs, remove the jobs.

commit_message:
mitaka-eol: Handle astara

Remove trusty jobs for astara projects, the repos are all mitaka-eol'ed
with exception of openstack/astara which is an oversight (is in list to
retire). So, let's remove the obsolete jobs everywhere.

commit_message:
Switch from run_once back to inventory scoping

As it turns out, run_once executes a task
once per batch when executed from a serialised
playbook instead of once per set of play hosts
as previously thought.

In this patch we implement a combination of
dynamic inclusion, inventory scoping and
play host scoping to achieve the required
goal of only running it once, even when the
playbook is executed using limits.

Depends-On: I548971e2de92280fe2cc4ff0a6a926497733fa7d
Change-Id: Icde03cd2610f52859fd8d2d7540f442a36e51695

commit_message:
Improve inventory scoping for limited play execution

When executing the playbook with limits set, the scoping
currently does not work quite as well as one would hope.

This tightens it a bit more to ensure that it operates
as expected.

Change-Id: I8ebd42bcdf9676fd580955256498bbd8801f1cbd

subject: tests: host_vars: localhost: Do not disable PrivateDevices
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-07 08:47:07.000000000', 'files': ['tests/host_vars/localhost.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-memcached_server/commit/01f1a6a98cd92e91e2de1e5bfe11c190709fdceb', 'message': 'tests: host_vars: localhost: Do not disable PrivateDevices

The tests are making use of the common/test-vars.yml file which uses
the following condition to determine if PrivateDevices need to be
disabled or not

{{ ((properties.is_metal | default(false)) | bool) | ternary('false', 'true') }}"

However, 'properties' is not defined in that role leading to the
following problem

fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "failed": true, "msg": "AnsibleUndefinedVariable: {{ ((properties.is_metal | default(false)) | bool) | ternary('false', 'true') }}: 'properties' is undefined"}

We can safely define this variable for the tests in order to override
the one from the common yaml file.

Change-Id: Iedaf10b4a194a8f9a9f35acd7e08e4bf7209dd5c
'}]
commit_message:
tests: host_vars: localhost: Do not disable PrivateDevices

The tests are making use of the common/test-vars.yml file which uses
the following condition to determine if PrivateDevices need to be
disabled or not

{{ ((properties.is_metal | default(false)) | bool) | ternary('false', 'true') }}"

However, 'properties' is not defined in that role leading to the
following problem

fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {"changed": false, "failed": true, "msg": "AnsibleUndefinedVariable: {{ ((properties.is_metal | default(false)) | bool) | ternary('false', 'true') }}: 'properties' is undefined"}

We can safely define this variable for the tests in order to override
the one from the common yaml file.

Change-Id: Iedaf10b4a194a8f9a9f35acd7e08e4bf7209dd5c

commit_message:
add to judge whether resources end up with 'y' when clean up

When clean up some resources in neutron, some resources such as
policy which end up with 'y', it will be add 's' in the end.
Actually it should be 'ies', or the resources will not be deleted.

Change-Id: I161050421b2a0480756a8548192e11ff10718c3b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/26/480926/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if self._resource.endswith('y'): resources = self._resource[:-1] + "ies" else: resources = self._resource + "s"

commit_message:
use the variable holding the service types url instead of an inline value

There is a global variable with the URL for the service types authority
list. Use that instead of the hard-coded value.

Change-Id: I05187afd72b3e18c6308dba257fcc4d41e604d7e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix the way the language bindings page renders

The template was looking for service_type instead of the service
description. One of the clients did not have a description value.

Change-Id: I688add052242327a8f2ea6fb76e0f0e8077d96b4
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Prevent unexpected abort when initializing fernet key authentication

Without this patch, the play aborts without retries when
fernet_create.stdout.split()[2] doesn't exist.

Change-Id: I8f9cd7830051f7b1cbfc607dbfd85a6452e0571a
Closes-Bug: #1700715
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/18/477818/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: until: "(fernet_create.stdout.split() | length > 2 and fernet_create.stdout.split()[2] == 'SUCCESS') or (fernet_create.stdout.find('Key repository is already initialized') != -1)"
deleted_lines: until: "(fernet_create.stdout.split()[2] == 'SUCCESS') or (fernet_create.stdout.find('Key repository is already initialized') != -1)"

commit_message:
Use GroupSnapshotStatus enum field

The GroupSnapshotStatus and GroupSnapshotStatusField have been defined
already, This change just replaces the omissive group snapshot string
status with group snapshot enum field.

Change-Id: Ib7317c8d610e215f38d1ef5afe582ff44af006bd
Partial-Implements: bp cinder-object-fields

commit_message:
added openstack.bash_completion file

to support the function of autocomplete for openstack's commands

Change-Id: Id9fb771ca642cef4d44c350f463197c36e6afdb6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/55/477855/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _openstack_opts="" # lazy init _openstack_flags="" # lazy init _openstack_opts_exp="" # lazy init _openstack() { local cur prev nbc cflags COMPREPLY=() cur="${COMP_WORDS[COMP_CWORD]}" prev="${COMP_WORDS[COMP_CWORD-1]}" if [ "x$_openstack_opts" == "x" ] ; then nbc="`openstack bash-completion | sed -e "s/ *-h */ /" -e "s/ *-i */ /"`" _openstack_opts="`echo "$nbc" | sed -e "s/--[a-z0-9_-]*//g" -e "s/ */ /g"`" _openstack_flags="`echo " $nbc" | sed -e "s/ [^-][^-][a-z0-9_-]*//g" -e "s/ */ /g"`" _openstack_opts_exp="`echo "$_openstack_opts" | tr ' ' '|'`" fi if [[ " ${COMP_WORDS[@]} " =~ " "($_openstack_opts_exp)" " && "$prev" != "help" ]] ; then COMPLETION_CACHE=$HOME/.cache/python-openstackclient/*/*-cache cflags="$_openstack_flags "$(cat $COMPLETION_CACHE 2> /dev/null | tr '\n' ' ') COMPREPLY=($(compgen -W "${cflags}" -- ${cur})) else COMPREPLY=($(compgen -W "${_openstack_opts}" -- ${cur})) fi return 0 } complete -F _openstack openstack

commit_message:
misc cleanups

Cosmetic cleanups only:
- API definition: use constants from neutron-lib
- API definition: remove useless EXT_TO_SERVICE_MAPPING use
- BGPVPN driver API: add missing precommit abstract methods
- tests: better indendation of with statements
- tests: better error reporting when developing tests
- s/datas/data

Change-Id: I772b6c9c904423aa0d0e0ab6cdaeca63f5907f07

commit_message:
dashboard: fix bug about the create BGPVPN form

We can't display the form to create a new
BGPVPN in panel admin > BGPVPN Interconnections.

Django 1.9 is now used by Horizon. In this release,
url tag from future library is removed. So it's
impossible to use this tag in a jinja template.

Change-Id: Ie4f96019521136ccca29216056a5d94a55b9ae2f
Closes-Bug: 1702287
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/68/480168/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: form_id = "create_bgpvpn_form" submit_label = _("Create BGPVPN") submit_url = reverse_lazy("horizon:admin:bgpvpn:create")

commit_message:
dashboard: change clean method in create and update

When a user create or edit a BGP VPN, the attributes
RTs are still sent in the API request even if the
related fields are empty.

This path change this behavior. So, in the form, if the
RTs fields are empty, the attributes aren't sent in
the API request.

Change-Id: I93e68f16aed31ea8ad99579e3cd7cb498bf85e14

commit_message:
Replace the usage of 'manager' with 'os_primary'

In tempest, alias 'manager' has been moved to 'os_primary'
in version Pike, and it will be removed in version Queens.
This patch is to replace the usage of 'manager' with 'os_primary'.

For other details, please check [1] and [2]
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/468036/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/463484/

Change-Id: I3f6b35ad4b018b84fe6538a408a63aac2f6d5510

commit_message:
Use more specific asserts in tests/unit tests

I changed asserts with more specific assert methods.
e.g.: from assertTrue(x in y) to assertIn(x, y).

The code gets more readable, and a better description will be shown on fail

Change-Id: Ic80d9313a5eedb4f9f604847f99b861419f8f9b0

'}]
commit_message:
RemoteFS: prevent creation of encrypted volumes

Support for volume encryption of FS-based volumes is not
currently implemented in Nova.  Creating encrypted volumes
with these drivers can result in dangerous and undesired
behavior.  Block creation of encrypted volumes for these
drivers until this is supported.

This adds a per-driver switch which can be used to enable
this for individual RemoteFS drivers as they are tested.

Closes-Bug: #1675469

Change-Id: I39d4230106c891e1b480989daaf72bea5a64e4b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/05/449205/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
OpenVPN deployment with Murano, for OpenStack

OpenVPN allows for a secure & encrypted channel of communication between
end points on different networks. It does so by createing secure
ethernet bridges using virtual tap devices. This feature enables nodes
on private network to onboard nodes on public network to present a
seemless and virtually unified cluster in a hybrid environment.

Implements: blueprint murano-openvpn

Change-Id: I99e76d51d8cd269431db8c90c66f218e871e1ec7
Co-Authored-By: Bhasker Nallapothula <bhaskern@vedams.com>
Co-Authored-By: Shanker Iyer <shankeri@vedams.com>
Co-Authored-By: Gangadhar Sunkara <gangadhars@vedams.com>
Co-Authored-By: Pradip Kumar Rawat <pradipkumarr@vedams.com>

commit_message:
Consolidate final two keystone plays

The final two keystone plays target the same
host groups and use the same settings, so they
may as well consolidate to slightly optimise
the execution.

Change-Id: I5ff3862b7569f42292a0dc339c980bcbe5dd855b
(cherry picked from commit 2ba98007e63181b5ee9f60e3fdaf6a47668e57cd)

commit_message:
Allow keystone playbook to work with limits

With this adjustment, when the keystone playbook
is executed using limits it will still execute
all the correct tasks.

Depends-On: Id2034562b3e26da56c36dd88badddf1a3b623e20
Change-Id: Iddc30e0ac1eed315c83c4bd89573a15535754157
(cherry picked from commit 1e7085a33e12583f277ba9b7863bffecaddfb7e1)

commit_message:
Switch from oslosphinx to openstackdocstheme

As part of the docs migration work[0] for Pike we need to switch to use
the openstackdocstheme. Clean up python build warnings to enable
warning-is-error. Part of doc-migration work.

Change-Id: Id4b69ae5c57697228c4612c489a952657b0fdbfe
Depends-On: Ia750cb049c0f53a234ea70ce1f2bbbb7a2aa9454

added_lines: warning-is-error = 1

commit_message:
Implement rolling upgrades for keystone

The current rolling upgrade implementation
relies on the role to orchestrate the rolling
upgrade. When the role is executed using
playbook serialisation, the db sync contract
is executed before all hosts are upgraded,
potentially resulting in data corruption.

This patch implements the use of playbook
serialisation for the upgrade and fact checking
to determine when it is safe to execute the db
sync contract.

Additionally, tasks which only need to be
executed against a single keystone host
in the invevntory are specifically targeted
rather than being skipped on the other hosts.
This should provide a slight performance
improvement.

Backport note:
- The serial values were all changed to '1' due to
  Ansible 2.1's lack of support for a list value.

Depends-On: I5650f16b9a115bd392012b743788057a94d09226
Change-Id: Iac59e792a642a9e57d6d279a7d4b3d41fe419b38
(cherry picked from commit ecf32e20784d733fa89e1b0a392fd4b565ca4f41)

added_lines: - name: Prepare MQ/DB services environment: "{{ deployment_environment_variables | default({}) }}" tags: - keystone tasks: - name: Configure rabbitmq vhost/user include: common-tasks/rabbitmq-vhost-user.yml - "groups[keystone_rabbitmq_host_group] | length > 0" run_once: yes - name: Configure rabbitmq vhost/user (telemetry) include: common-tasks/rabbitmq-vhost-user.yml - "keystone_ceilometer_enabled | bool" - "groups[keystone_rabbitmq_telemetry_host_group] is defined" - "groups[keystone_rabbitmq_telemetry_host_group] | length > 0" - "groups[keystone_rabbitmq_telemetry_host_group] != groups[keystone_rabbitmq_host_group]" run_once: yes - name: Configure MySQL user include: common-tasks/mysql-db-user.yml run_once: yes - name: Installation and setup of Keystone hosts: keystone_all serial: "{{ keystone_serial | default(['1', '100%']) }}" gather_facts: "{{ gather_facts | default(True) }}" max_fail_percentage: 20 user: root environment: "{{ deployment_environment_variables | default({}) }}" tags: - keystone pre_tasks: # In order to ensure that any container, software or # config file changes which causes a container/service # restart do not cause an unexpected outage, we drain # the load balancer back end for this container. - include: common-tasks/haproxy-endpoint-manage.yml vars: haproxy_backend: "{{ item }}" haproxy_state: disabled when: "{{ groups['keystone_all'] | length > 1 }}" with_items: - "keystone_service-back" - "keystone_admin-back" - name: Configure container include: common-tasks/os-lxc-container-setup.yml vars: extra_container_config_no_restart: - "lxc.start.order=89" - name: Configure log directories (on metal) include: common-tasks/os-log-dir-setup.yml vars: log_dirs: - src: "/openstack/log/{{ inventory_hostname }}-keystone" dest: "/var/log/keystone" - name: Configure package proxy cache include: common-tasks/package-cache-proxy.yml post_tasks: # Now that container changes are done, we can set # the load balancer back end for this container # to available again. - include: common-tasks/haproxy-endpoint-manage.yml vars: haproxy_backend: "{{ item }}" haproxy_state: enabled when: "{{ groups['keystone_all'] | length > 1 }}" with_items: - "keystone_service-back" - "keystone_admin-back" # These facts are set against the deployment host to ensure that # they are fast to access. This is done in preference to setting # them against each target as the hostvars extraction will take # a long time if executed against a large inventory. - name: Refresh local facts after all software changes are made hosts: keystone_all max_fail_percentage: 20 user: root environment: "{{ deployment_environment_variables | default({}) }}" tasks: - name: refresh local facts setup: filter: ansible_local gather_subset: "!all" # This variable contains the values of the local fact set for the keystone # venv tag for all hosts in the 'keystone_all' host group. - name: Gather software version list set_fact: keystone_all_software_versions: "{{ (groups['keystone_all'] | map('extract', hostvars, ['ansible_local', 'openstack_ansible', 'keystone', 'venv_tag'])) | list }}" delegate_to: localhost run_once: yes # This variable outputs a boolean value which is True when # keystone_all_software_versions contains a list of defined # values. If they are not defined, it means that not all # hosts have their software deployed yet. - name: Set software deployed fact set_fact: keystone_all_software_deployed: "{{ (keystone_all_software_versions | select('defined')) | list == keystone_all_software_versions }}" delegate_to: localhost run_once: yes # This variable outputs a boolean when all the values in # keystone_all_software_versions are the same and the software # has been deployed to all hosts in the group. - name: Set software updated fact set_fact: keystone_all_software_updated: "{{ ((keystone_all_software_versions | unique) | length == 1) and (keystone_all_software_deployed | bool) }}" delegate_to: localhost run_once: yes - name: Perform the final stage of the database migrations hosts: keystone_all[0] gather_facts: no user: root environment: "{{ deployment_environment_variables | default({}) }}" tags: - keystone tasks: - name: Perform a Keystone DB sync contract command: "{{ keystone_bin }}/keystone-manage db_sync --contract" become: yes become_user: "{{ keystone_system_user_name }}" when: - "keystone_all_software_updated | bool" - "ansible_local['openstack_ansible']['keystone']['need_db_contract'] | bool" register: dbsync_contract - name: Disable the need for any further db sync ini_file: dest: "/etc/ansible/facts.d/openstack_ansible.fact" section: keystone option: "{{ item }}" value: False with_items: - "need_db_sync" - "need_db_contract" when: - "dbsync_contract | succeeded"
deleted_lines: - name: Installation and setup of Keystone max_fail_percentage: 20 pre_tasks: - include: common-tasks/os-lxc-container-setup.yml vars: extra_container_config_no_restart: - "lxc.start.order=89" - include: common-tasks/rabbitmq-vhost-user.yml static: no - inventory_hostname == groups['keystone_all'][0] - groups[keystone_rabbitmq_host_group] | length > 0 - include: common-tasks/rabbitmq-vhost-user.yml static: no - keystone_ceilometer_enabled | bool - inventory_hostname == groups['keystone_all'][0] - groups[keystone_rabbitmq_telemetry_host_group] is defined - groups[keystone_rabbitmq_telemetry_host_group] | length > 0 - groups[keystone_rabbitmq_telemetry_host_group] != groups[keystone_rabbitmq_host_group] - include: common-tasks/os-log-dir-setup.yml vars: log_dirs: - src: "/openstack/log/{{ inventory_hostname }}-keystone" dest: "/var/log/keystone" - include: common-tasks/mysql-db-user.yml static: no when: inventory_hostname == groups['keystone_all'][0] - include: common-tasks/package-cache-proxy.yml vars: is_metal: "{{ properties.is_metal|default(false) }}" keystone_admin_port: 35357 keystone_galera_user: keystone keystone_galera_database: keystone keystone_galera_address: "{{ galera_address }}"

commit_message:
Filter visibility of the dashboard

Dashboard "Workflow" should be displayed only when the service is available in
service catalog returned by Keystone.

Change-Id: I9e2e4196889b5e06c11720e60c1a915902ab3cd0
Closes-Bug: #1646780

commit_message:
Fixes wrong path for Roboto in the filesystem

Fonts are available under fonts/roboto/Roboto-*, whereas
SCSS references to them always as Roboto. Filesystem is
case-sensitive, therefore this patch makes SCSS use the
correct path to the file by lowercasing the variable used.

Change-Id: Ic90e608938f80199c54a8d8ba0d40345d3a1f731
Closes-bug: #1671004
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/xstatic-roboto-fontface refs/changes/25/443025/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix arguments for OS::Mistral::CronTrigger create

In python-mistralclient, the `workflow_name` argument was renamed to
`workflow_identifier` in version 2.0.0, breaking this resource type. Ensure
that this works with all client versions by passing the first two arguments
as positional rather than keyword args.

Change-Id: Ibbed3af468bbc0d68995495095b6cd340c1ea427
Closes-Bug: #1557575
(cherry picked from commit f682e7afed80ea0bcd19f42644a64a0b750f3eac)

commit_message:
Update deployment guide to use 1.6.4.

Add a string warning that 1.6.3 is DOA and remove the section with the
workaround for 1.6.3.

Add a note that 1.7.0 is stable if desired.

Change-Id: Ifa6eb1c5d4a3c394f8082ebc06dca2f31d5b7b8b

Note that kubernetes 1.6.3 is DOA and will not work. 1.7.0 appears to be stable and is working in the gates, and is the current latest version.Install Kubernetes 1.6.4 or later and other dependencies::Install Kubernetes 1.6.4 or later and other dependencies::

This is fixed in 1.6.4. 1.7.0 appears to be stable and is working in the gates.Install Kubernetes 1.6.2 or later and other dependencies::Currently kubelet 1.6.3 is broken. Until #45613 is in the repo install the following work-around:: curl -L https://github.com/sbezverk/kubelet--45613/raw/master/kubelet.gz | gzip -d > /usr/bin/kubelet chmod +x /usr/bin/kubelet Install Kubernetes 1.6.2 or later and other dependencies::

commit_message:
Replace voluptuous with JSONSchema to validate change_node_power_state

Now in watcher,both JSONSchema and voluptuous are used to validate
JSON payloads. We want to remove voluptuous and Use
JSONSchema as our only JSON validation tool to keep consistence
and also to make it easier to expose the validation schema
through our API in future work.

In this patch, we replace voluptuous with JSONSchema to validate
the change_node_power_state action in watcher applier.

Partially Implements: blueprint jsonschema-validation

Change-Id: If9ffe5e0b107e0da5673247e4d5ec9917790827f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher refs/changes/30/481130/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import jsonschema return { 'type': 'object', 'properties': { 'resource_id': { 'type': 'string', "minlength": 1 }, 'state': { 'type': 'string', 'enum': [NodeState.POWERON.value, NodeState.POWEROFF.value] } }, 'required': ['resource_id', 'state'], 'additionalProperties': False, } def validate_parameters(self): try: jsonschema.validate(self.input_parameters, self.schema) return True except jsonschema.ValidationError as e: raise e
deleted_lines: import six import voluptuous return voluptuous.Schema({ voluptuous.Required(self.RESOURCE_ID): voluptuous.All( voluptuous.Any(*six.string_types), voluptuous.Length(min=1)), voluptuous.Required(self.STATE): voluptuous.Any(*[NodeState.POWERON.value, NodeState.POWEROFF.value]), })

commit_message:
Add spec for heat tempest converge

Change-Id: Idc3fef0edba98cc597a517548799ac2f459d9a7e
Blueprint: heat-tempest-converge
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/39/455039/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ========================== Heat tempest test converge ========================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/heat-tempest-converge Heat integration tests right now are capable running with tempest test through heat tempest plugin. With the goal to better integrate with tempest. This blueprint proposes to converge the test structure into tempest structure, to avoid duplicated config in tempest and using python client library. Problem description =================== This Blueprint tries to target fallowing problems: 1. Duplicated authentication info for heat tempest Most of the tempest plugins (like [1] and [2]) use origin authentication information provided by default tempest setup (as shown in tempest's document[3]), this allows centralized the authentication process. And we don't have to keep those authentication management process on us anymore. 2. Use and manage python clients for tests in heat Tempest test should directly use unified clients, which tempest already provides direct API client managers for most services who using tempest. Right now heat test still provides our own python clients in client manager which means we have three places of breakdown chances (in heat, heat test clients, and APIs from other services). Also tempest base class provides some base library for tests which we can avoid rewrite it by us. Proposed change =============== As proposed in https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/heat-tempest-converge,n,z with fallowing changes: * Add endpoint type config in test configurations. As we previous hard code in test manager. * Add base tempest class to use directlt tempest native test class and clients. Also, can use the authentication from basic tempest config. * Change API tests to use base tempest class. API test are the easiest converged group, as they're the one group of tests that did not require clients. * Add API client manager for heat, like other clients in the tempest. * Change test clients and base structure to adapt tempest native test class. For test use, original heat test class or tempest native class will not be affected. Tests will skip if services or config not available. * Converge tests in `heat_integrationtests` to use new base test class. Alternatives ------------ We can also make our mind to we not going to use tempest structure in heat as long as our test can run with tempest command just fine. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Rico Lin <rico-lin> And anyone who is interesting in doing this. Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: pike-rc1 Work Items ---------- * Add base tempest structure in heat repository * Add base API clients for heat API services. * Make sure old test can running just fine, and new tests must use new structure. This also includes document the structure down. Dependencies ============ https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bp/heat-tempest-converge,n,z [1] https://github.com/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin [2] https://github.com/openstack/gnocchi [3] https://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/configuration.html#test-credentials

commit_message:
Update security compliance documentation

The security compliance settings in the admin guide
referenced configuration options that no longer work.
The functionality to exclude users from password expiry
or password changing was moved to per user resource options.

This change also consolidates the duplicate documentation
between the advanced topics in the operator guide into the
admin-guide.

Closes-Bug: #1701389
Change-Id: I36be658f0a1efb25c55b24596bf67639c69c89d9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/57/479357/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: If there exists a user whos password you do not want to expire, keystone supports setting that user's option 'ignore_password_expiry' to true: `/v3/users/3a54353c9dcc44f690975ea768512f6a` .. code-block:: JSON { user: { options: { "ignore_password_expiry": true } } } In this example, the password expiration for user ID ``3a54353c9dcc44f690975ea768512f6a`` would not be honored.
deleted_lines: In addition, you can set it so that passwords never expire for some users by adding their user ID to ``password_expires_ignore_user_ids`` list: .. code-block:: ini [security_compliance] password_expires_ignore_user_ids = [3a54353c9dcc44f690975ea768512f6a] In this example, the password for user ID ``3a54353c9dcc44f690975ea768512f6a`` would never expire.

commit_message:
Fix html_last_updated_fmt for Python3

html_last_updated_fmt option is interpreted as a
byte string in python3, causing Sphinx build to break.
This patch makes it utf-8 string.

Change-Id: Ie3a0ca9c53d9ac7d6137a09a8afc64b98c045ece
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/70/480670/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Converge gabbi API tests to use base tempest class

This patch allow as to call gabbi API tests from
tempest with base tempest class.
Gabbi API tests like other tests, that we can use original
authN. info to run tempest test. After this patch we can run API
test with base tempest class.
Partially-Implements: blueprint heat-tempest-converge

Change-Id: I1721b07ce205f349cf8f7df4ecdf583c6aef9e71
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/67/453567/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(ricolin) In near future, we will integrate most of heat tempest # config to other tempest config (like to integrate authentication config) # List loaded tests with tempest (this might not works for gabbi tests) cd $DEST/tempest tempest run --list-tests --regex heat_integrationtests If you try to run gabbi API tests under heat_integrationtests, you must use tempest authentication config under [identity] and [auth]. Therefore make sure you config your tempest well before you try to run heat API test under heat_integrationtests. tempest run --regex heat_integrationtests.api

commit_message:
Add base tempest class for heat

We have start to adopt tempest plugin and allow our test on top of
it. This patch add base class for heat tempest test that will use
authentication and clients from tempest base class. We will
converge our tempest test base on these base client and client
manager in future.
Partially-Implements: blueprint heat-tempest-converge

Change-Id: Ie1b81abac4a3afb0d7f07f16a3b876f1fb6f950e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/66/453566/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import functools import six from six.moves.urllib import parse from oslo_log import log as logging from oslo_serialization import jsonutils from tempest.lib.common import rest_client from tempest.lib import exceptions LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def handle_errors(f): """A decorator that allows to ignore certain types of errors.""" @functools.wraps(f) def wrapper(*args, **kwargs): param_name = 'ignore_errors' ignore_errors = kwargs.get(param_name, tuple()) if param_name in kwargs: del kwargs[param_name] try: return f(*args, **kwargs) except ignore_errors as e: # Silently ignore errors as requested. LOG.debug('Ignoring exception of type %s, as requested', type(e)) return wrapper class HeatClientBase(rest_client.RestClient): """Base tempest REST client for Heat API.""" uri_prefix = '' entity_name = '' CREATE_STATUS_CODES = [] SHOW_STATUS_CODES = [] LIST_STATUS_CODES = [] PUT_STATUS_CODES = [] UPDATE_STATUS_CODES = [] DELETE_STATUS_CODES = [] def serialize(self, data): if isinstance(data, six.string_types): return data return jsonutils.dumps(data) def deserialize(self, resp, object_str): if 'application/json' in resp['content-type']: return jsonutils.loads(object_str) else: raise exceptions.InvalidContentType() @classmethod def expected_success(cls, expected_code, read_code): if not isinstance(read_code, int): message = ("expected_success(%(expected_code)r, %(read_code)r) " "received non-int read_code %(read_code)r" % {'expected_code': expected_code, 'read_code': read_code}) LOG.warning(message) return super(HeatClientBase, cls).expected_success( expected_code=expected_code, read_code=int(read_code), ) def get_uri(self, project_id, resource_name, obj_stack_name=None, obj_stack_uuid=None, uuid=None, extra_paths=None, params=None): """Get URI for a sepcific resource or object. :param project_id: The UUID of the project for the REST resource. :param resource_name: The name of the REST resource, e.q., 'stacks'. :param obj_stack_name: Name of the stack in string format. :param obj_stack_uuid: The unique identifier of stack in UUID format. :param uuid: The unique identifier of an object in UUID format. :param extra_paths (list): extra paths for URI. :param params (dict): Represents the query parameters to include in the request URI. :returns: Relative URI for the resource or object. """ uri_pattern = ('{pref}/{project_id}/{res}{obj_stack_name}' '{obj_stack_uuid}{uuid}{extra_paths}{params}') obj_stack_uuid = ( '/%s' % obj_stack_uuid if obj_stack_uuid is not None else '') obj_stack_name = ( '/%s' % obj_stack_name if obj_stack_name is not None else '') uuid = '/%s' % uuid if uuid is not None else '' params = '?%s' % parse.urlencode(params) if params is not None else '' extra_paths = "/".join( extra_paths) if isinstance(extra_paths, list) else '' return uri_pattern.format(pref=self.uri_prefix, project_id=project_id, res=resource_name, obj_stack_name=obj_stack_name, obj_stack_uuid=obj_stack_uuid, uuid=uuid, extra_paths=extra_paths, params=params) def _create_request(self, project_id, resource=None, data=None, params=None, headers=None, extra_headers=False): """Create an object of the specified type. :param project_id: The UUID of the project for the REST resource. :param resource: The name if the REST resource, e.q., 'stacks'. :param data (dict): Represents an object of the specified type (to be serialized) or a plain string which is sent as-is. :param params (dict): Represents the query parameters to include in the request URI. :param headers (dict): The headers to use for the request. :param extra_headers (bool): Indicates if the headers returned by the get_headers() method are to be used but additional headers are needed in the request pass them in as a dict. :returns: A tuple with the server response and the response body. """ body = self.serialize(data) if resource is None: resource = self.entity_name uri = self.get_uri(project_id, resource, params=params) resp, body = self.post(uri, body, headers=headers, extra_headers=extra_headers) self.expected_success(self.CREATE_STATUS_CODES, resp.status) return resp, self.deserialize(resp, body) def _show_request(self, project_id, resource=None, uuid, obj_stack_name=None, obj_stack_uuid=None, params=None, headers=None, extra_headers=False): """Get an object of the specified type. :param project_id: The UUID of the project for the REST resource. :param resource: The name if the REST resource, e.q., 'stacks'. :param obj_stack_name: Name of the stack in string format. :param obj_stack_uuid: The unique identifier of stack in UUID format. :param uuid: The unique identifier of an object in UUID format. :param params (dict): Represents the query parameters to include in the request URI. :param headers (dict): The headers to use for the request. :param extra_headers (bool): Indicates if the headers returned by the get_headers() method are to be used but additional headers are needed in the request pass them in as a dict. :returns: Serialized object as a dictionary. """ if resource is None: resource = self.entity_name uri = self.get_uri(project_id, resource, obj_stack_name=obj_stack_name, obj_stack_uuid=obj_stack_uuid, uuid=uuid, params=params) resp, body = self.get(uri, headers=headers, extra_headers=extra_headers) self.expected_success(self.SHOW_STATUS_CODES, resp.status) return resp, self.deserialize(resp, body) def _list_request(self, project_id, resource=None, obj_stack_name=None, obj_stack_uuid=None, params=None): """Gets a list of objects. :param project_id: The UUID of the project for the REST resource. :param resource: The name if the REST resource, e.q., 'stacks'. :param obj_stack_name: Name of the stack in string format. :param obj_stack_uuid: The unique identifier of stack in UUID format. :param params (dict): Represents the query parameters to include in the request URI. :returns: Serialized object as a dictionary. """ if resource is None: resource = self.entity_name uri = self.get_uri(project_id, resource=resource, obj_stack_name=obj_stack_name, obj_stack_uuid=obj_stack_uuid, params=params) resp, body = self.get(uri) self.expected_success(self.LIST_STATUS_CODES, resp.status) return resp, self.deserialize(resp, body) def _put_request(self, project_id, data, uuid, resource=None, obj_stack_name=None, obj_stack_uuid=None, params=None): """Update the specified object using PUT request. :param project_id: The UUID of the project for the REST resource. :param resource: The name if the REST resource, e.q., 'stacks'. :param obj_stack_name: Name of the stack in string format. :param obj_stack_uuid: The unique identifier of stack in UUID format. :param uuid: The unique identifier of an object in UUID format. :param data (dict): Represents an object of the specified type (to be serialized) or a plain string which is sent as-is. :param params (dict): Represents the query parameters to include in the request URI. :returns: Serialized object as a dictionary. """ body = self.serialize(data) if resource is None: resource = self.entity_name uri = self.get_uri(project_id, resource, obj_stack_name=obj_stack_name, obj_stack_uuid=obj_stack_uuid, uuid=uuid, params=params) resp, body = self.put(uri, body=body) self.expected_success(self.PUT_STATUS_CODES, resp.status) return resp, self.deserialize(resp, body) def _update_request(self, project_id, data, uuid, resource=None, obj_stack_name=None, obj_stack_uuid=None, params=None, headers=None, extra_headers=False): """Update the specified object using PATCH request. :param project_id: The UUID of the project for the REST resource. :param resource: The name if the REST resource, e.q., 'stacks'. :param obj_stack_name: Name of the stack in string format. :param obj_stack_uuid: The unique identifier of stack in UUID format. :param uuid: The unique identifier of an object in UUID format. :param data (dict): Represents an object of the specified type (to be serialized) or a plain string which is sent as-is. :param params (dict): Represents the query parameters to include in the request URI. :param headers (dict): The headers to use for the request. :param extra_headers (bool): Indicates if the headers returned by the get_headers() method are to be used but additional headers are needed in the request pass them in as a dict. :returns: Serialized object as a dictionary. """ body = self.serialize(data) if resource is None: resource = self.entity_name uri = self.get_uri(project_id, resource, obj_stack_name=obj_stack_name, obj_stack_uuid=obj_stack_uuid, uuid=uuid, params=params) resp, body = self.patch(uri, body=body, headers=headers, extra_headers=extra_headers) self.expected_success(self.UPDATE_STATUS_CODES, resp.status) return resp, self.deserialize(resp, body) def _delete_request(self, project_id, uuid, resource=None, obj_stack_name=None, obj_stack_uuid=None, params=None, headers=None, extra_headers=False): """Deletes the specified object. :param project_id: The UUID of the project for the REST resource. :param resource: The name if the REST resource, e.q., 'stacks'. :param obj_stack_name: Name of the stack in string format. :param obj_stack_uuid: The unique identifier of stack in UUID format. :param uuid: The unique identifier of an object in UUID format. :param params (dict): Represents the query parameters to include in the request URI. :param headers (dict): The headers to use for the request. :param extra_headers (bool): Indicates if the headers returned by the get_headers() method are to be used but additional headers are needed in the request pass them in as a dict. :returns: A tuple with the server response and the response body. """ if resource is None: resource = self.entity_name uri = self.get_uri(project_id, resource, obj_stack_name=obj_stack_name, obj_stack_uuid=obj_stack_uuid, uuid=uuid, params=params) resp, body = self.delete(uri, headers=headers, extra_headers=extra_headers) self.expected_success(self.DELETE_STATUS_CODES, resp.status) if resp.status != 204: body = self.deserialize(resp, body) return resp, body

commit_message:
Add endpoint_type to heat group config

We have hard code the endpoint type for client in
integration test. This patch add endpoint_type under
heat group config. The default value will be `publicURL`.
Partially-Implements: blueprint heat-tempest-converge

Change-Id: I50400fb8fd0696c9337963312b154df992dd5aff

subject: Use _is_dns_integration_supported for _delete_floatingip
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-06 14:24:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/797f300edec94f445edb623b0bedab1c818e1bd1', 'message': 'Use _is_dns_integration_supported for _delete_floatingip

L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin._delete_floatingip still uses utils.is_extension_supported
to determine if DNS-specific methods should be run rather than the
self._is_dns_integration_supported method used by _create and _update.

This causes issues with L3 service plugins like Cisco ACI where the core plugin is ML2
but the L3 plugin does not implement the DNS methods. When such a plugin sets
_dns_integration to False, _create and _update do not call the DNS-specific plugin
methods, but _delete_floatingip does which leads to an exception being raised.

This patch changes _delete_floatingip to use the same method for determining DNS
support as _create_floatingip and _update_floatingip.

Change-Id: Ieb2db6cb96c5d6aae166aa7f0d2d481b2a3690f9

commit_message:
Use _is_dns_integration_supported for _delete_floatingip

L3_NAT_dbonly_mixin._delete_floatingip still uses
utils.is_extension_supported to determine if DNS-specific methods should
be run rather than the self._is_dns_integration_supported method used
by _create and _update.

This causes issues with L3 service plugins like Cisco ACI where the core
plugin is ML2 but the L3 plugin does not implement the DNS methods.
When such a plugin sets _dns_integration to False, _create and _update
do not call the DNS-specific plugin methods, but _delete_floatingip does
 which leads to an exception being raised.

This patch changes _delete_floatingip to use the same method for
determining DNS support as _create_floatingip and _update_floatingip.

Change-Id: Ieb2db6cb96c5d6aae166aa7f0d2d481b2a3690f9
Closes-Bug: #1702693

commit_message:
Enforce clarity by using keyword-only arguments

For the call to create a RequestContext object, ensure that the caller
is using keyword arguments. The benefit of this is that there is no
confusion about what arguments are being used.

Previously callers could make a call like:
    ctx = RequestContext(None, 'user', None, 'example.com')

This change will require the callers to specify each argument using a
keyword.

Update call to oslo_context.context.RequestContext that was not using
keywords.

Added unit tests for change. Added autospec=True to mocks of
RequestContext.

Change-Id: Iba835d5f97e60acf69a3fa2002191687778ce971

commit_message:
Gear documentation towards a wider audience

Our documentation previously had a statement saying it was primarily
geared towards contributing developers. This commit removes that
statement and replaces it with a more general one. Subsequent patches
are going to be migrating a bunch of useful information for
contributors, developers, and operators alike.

Change-Id: I8cea91b755f53265c21ec72b01939a7c646d3756

commit_message:
Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher

oslo.messaging allow dispatcher to restrict endpoint methods
since 5.11.0 in d3a8f280ebd6fd12865fd20c4d772774e39aefa2, set with
DefaultRPCAccessPolicy to fix FutureWarning like:

FutureWarning: The access_policy argument is changing its default
value to <class 'oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher.DefaultRPCAccessPolicy'>
in version '?', please update the code to explicitly set None as the
value: access_policy defaults to LegacyRPCAccessPolicy which exposes
private methods. Explicitly set access_policy to DefaultRPCAccessPolicy
or ExplicitRPCAccessPolicy.

Change-Id: Ie17832d64075080c17c09df675b216dbe8af16e6

commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim
support for Python 3.5 in the classifier.
This patch also adds the convenience py35 venv
and remove python 3.4.

Change-Id: Id5363a59d4dff28d47a79feb2b40d09d7e27cac4

added_lines: from osc_lib.command import command from osc_lib import utils columns = base.RUNTIME_COLUMNS class Create(command.ShowOne): columns = base.RUNTIME_COLUMNS def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(Create, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( "name", metavar='NAME', help="New runtime name.", ) parser.add_argument( "image", metavar='IMAGE', help="Container image name used by runtime.", ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): client = self.app.client_manager.function_engine runtime = client.runtimes.create( name=parsed_args.name, image=parsed_args.image ) return self.columns, utils.get_item_properties(runtime, self.columns) class Delete(base.QinlingDeleter): def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(Delete, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'runtime', nargs='+', metavar='RUNTIME', help='Id of runtime(s).' ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): client = self.app.client_manager.function_engine self.delete = client.runtimes.delete self.resource = 'runtime' self.delete_resources(parsed_args.runtime)

commit_message:
Fix comment for API binary name in WSGIService

The compute API binary service name is a constant source of
confusion, sometimes called nova-api or nova-os_compute, which are
both wrong, since it's actually nova-osapi_compute. It comes from
nova.cmd.api.

Change-Id: I50befc34730296d3908b6dd25536394608bae0ec

deleted_lines: # NOTE(danms): Name can be metadata, os_compute, or ec2, per

commit_message:
fix readme.rst to reflect correct environment variable

The readme.rst incorrectly refers to the environment variable
DIB_APT_KEYS which should be DIB_ADD_APT_KEYS. See [1] for usage in
code.

This is a minor correction to the readme only, no runnable code is
modified.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/diskimage-builder/tree/diskimage_builder/elements/dpkg/extra-data.d/01-copy-apt-keys#n23

Change-Id: I04129cef9f40ec75a206c126bfd40ee61e4e6a2b

added_lines: DIB_ADD_APT_KEYS :Example: ``DIB_ADD_APT_KEYS=/etc/apt/trusted.gpg.d``

commit_message:
[3/3]Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be
negligible, see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

The patch list:
    1. api
    2. image
    3. network
    4. object
    5. volume
    6. tests

Partial-Implements: blueprint replace-iteritems-with-items

Change-Id: I8ac4f96d606a4530209de914542e035c3bd970c0

commit_message:
[1/3]Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be
negligible, see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

The patch list:
    1. common
    2. compute

Change-Id: I74ae16cd633830bd45a7702b8d74f60c92b02a42
Partial-Implements: blueprint replace-iteritems-with-items

commit_message:
[placement] Improve allocation_candidates coverage

The case where a bad resource class in resources can cause a 400
response was not covered. This adds it; things work as desired.

Change-Id: Ieb93889f76070b9ae37c082301488a953106d914
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/53/481153/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: get bad resource class GET: /allocation_candidates?resources=MCPU:99 status: 400 response_strings: - Invalid resource class in resources parameter

added_lines: /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/create-zanata-xml.py \ -p $project -v $version --srcdir . --txdir . \ -r '**/*.pot' '{path}/{locale_with_underscore}/LC_MESSAGES/{filename}.po' \ -e "$exclude" -f zanata.xml
deleted_lines: # For projects with one module on stable/mitaka, we use "old" setup. # Note that stable/mitaka is only stable translated branch for # projects. # TODO(jaegerandi): Remove once mitaka translation ends. if [ $# -eq 1 ] && [ "$version" == "stable-mitaka" ] ; then local modulename=$1 /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/create-zanata-xml.py \ -p $project -v $version --srcdir $modulename/locale \ --txdir $modulename/locale \ -r '**/*.pot' '{locale_with_underscore}/LC_MESSAGES/{filename}.po' \ -f zanata.xml else /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/create-zanata-xml.py \ -p $project -v $version --srcdir . --txdir . \ -r '**/*.pot' '{path}/{locale_with_underscore}/LC_MESSAGES/{filename}.po' \ -e "$exclude" -f zanata.xml fi

commit_message:
[POC] Introduction of OpenFlow implementation of DVR.

- Installation settings in devstack:
[[post-config|$NEUTRON_CONF]]
[DEFAULT]
service_plugins=neutron.services.l3_router.l3_router_plugin.L3RouterPlugin
router_distributed=True
[[post-config|/$Q_L3_CONF_FILE]]
[DEFAULT]
agent_mode=dvr_bridge
[ovs]
ovsdb_interface=vsctl
[[post-config|/$Q_DHCP_CONF_FILE]]
[DEFAULT]
force_metadata=True
enable_isolated_metadata=True
[[post-config|/$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE]]
[ml2]
types_drivers = vxlan,flat
tenant_network_types = vxlan
extension_drivers = port_security,qos
mechanism_drivers = openvswitch,l2population
[ml2_type_flat]
flat_networks = public
[agent]
l2_population=True
tunnel_types=vxlan
enable_distributed_routing=True
extensions=qos
[ovs]
ovsdb_interface=vsctl
of_interface=ovs-ofctl
local_ip=$HOST_IP

- East/West enabled on IPV4
- North/South enabled on IPV4

Change-Id: I47b41d99802b4f1adbcbd65d7011d780febd3987

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-05 17:25:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/db.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/a8d9ad93365dba06a2c44341fc5082daa363c60c', 'message': "Use subqueryload in l2pop DB for binding ports

commit_message:
Use subqueryload in l2pop DB for binding ports

This adjusts the l2pop DB queries that leverage the port relationship
on the PortBinding and DistributedPortBinding models to ensure that the
port gets loaded from the DB as part of the initial query.

Without this the number of DB queries will increase with the number
of ports since the port wasn't being loaded until the 'port' attribute
was referenced on its corresponding binding object.

Closes-Bug: #1701288
Change-Id: I7c3b08d525b2c90100c9fe4efaee973cf3a076f3
(cherry picked from commit 5be1ace5462994b492b811e20d8a90caac0fcffd)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/85/480685/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from sqlalchemy import orm query = query.options(orm.subqueryload(ml2_models.PortBinding.port)) query = query.options( orm.subqueryload(ml2_models.DistributedPortBinding.port))

commit_message:
Use subqueryload in l2pop DB for binding ports

This adjusts the l2pop DB queries that leverage the port relationship
on the PortBinding and DistributedPortBinding models to ensure that the
port gets loaded from the DB as part of the initial query.

Without this the number of DB queries will increase with the number
of ports since the port wasn't being loaded until the 'port' attribute
was referenced on its corresponding binding object.

Closes-Bug: #1701288
Change-Id: I7c3b08d525b2c90100c9fe4efaee973cf3a076f3
(cherry picked from commit 5be1ace5462994b492b811e20d8a90caac0fcffd)

added_lines: from sqlalchemy import orm query = query.options(orm.subqueryload(ml2_models.PortBinding.port)) query = query.options( orm.subqueryload(ml2_models.DistributedPortBinding.port))

subject: change fernet-key repository permissions to 750
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-07-06 04:47:58.000000000', 'files': ['docker/keystone/keystone-fernet/extend_start.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/1503dc792185bd18b95269e384cffd3a5c28e984', 'message': "change fernet-key repository permissions to 750

Keystone validates fernet-key repository directory is not readable
from others.  If it's readable, keystone logs the following warning
message.
WARNING keystone.common.fernet_utils [-] key_repository is world readable: /etc/keystone/fernet-keys/
This make change the permissions when the container starting.

Closes-bug:  #1668514
"}]
commit_message:
change fernet-key repository permissions to 750

Keystone validates fernet-key repository directory is not readable
from others.  If it's readable, keystone logs the following warning
message.
WARNING keystone.common.fernet_utils [-] key_repository is world readable: /etc/keystone/fernet-keys/
This make change the permissions when the container starting.

Change-Id: Id48c5042817e2530aace1f16915c36c60c544c06
Closes-bug:  #1668514
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/30/480830/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ $(stat -c %a ${FERNET_TOKEN_DIR}) != "750" ]]; then chmod 750 ${FERNET_TOKEN_DIR} fi

commit_message:
Adds NTP sync process to account for ceph time sync requirements.
Removes precheck portion of NTP.
Corrects for redhat
Fixes typo

Change-Id: Ic8d2cd3c2ba02f9f672db862a74950dc73753f2d
Closes-Bug: #1700121

""" def take_action(self, parsed_args): return (('Name',), [('value',)]) class TestShowOneHooks(base.TestBase): def setUp(self): super(TestShowOneHooks, self).setUp() self.app = make_app() self.cmd = TestShowCommand(self.app, None, cmd_name='test') self.hook = TestHook(self.cmd) self.mgr = extension.ExtensionManager.make_test_instance( [extension.Extension( 'parser-hook', None, None, self.hook)], ) # Replace the auto-loaded hooks with our explicitly created # manager. self.cmd._hooks = self.mgr def test_get_parser(self): parser = self.cmd.get_parser('test') results = parser.parse_args(['--added-by-hook', 'value']) self.assertEqual(results.added_by_hook, 'value') def test_get_epilog(self): results = self.cmd.get_epilog() self.assertIn('hook epilog', results) def test_before(self): self.assertFalse(self.hook._before_called) parser = self.cmd.get_parser('test') results = parser.parse_args(['--added-by-hook', 'value']) self.cmd.run(results) self.assertTrue(self.hook._before_called) def test_after(self): self.assertFalse(self.hook._after_called) parser = self.cmd.get_parser('test') results = parser.parse_args(['--added-by-hook', 'value']) self.cmd.run(results) self.assertTrue(self.hook._after_called) class TestListerHooks(base.TestBase): def setUp(self): super(TestListerHooks, self).setUp() self.app = make_app() self.cmd = TestListerCommand(self.app, None, cmd_name='test') self.hook = TestHook(self.cmd) self.mgr = extension.ExtensionManager.make_test_instance( [extension.Extension( 'parser-hook', None, None, self.hook)], ) # Replace the auto-loaded hooks with our explicitly created # manager. self.cmd._hooks = self.mgr def test_get_parser(self): parser = self.cmd.get_parser('test') results = parser.parse_args(['--added-by-hook', 'value']) self.assertEqual(results.added_by_hook, 'value') def test_get_epilog(self): results = self.cmd.get_epilog() self.assertIn('hook epilog', results) def test_before(self): self.assertFalse(self.hook._before_called) parser = self.cmd.get_parser('test') results = parser.parse_args(['--added-by-hook', 'value']) self.cmd.run(results) self.assertTrue(self.hook._before_called) def test_after(self): self.assertFalse(self.hook._after_called) parser = self.cmd.get_parser('test') results = parser.parse_args(['--added-by-hook', 'value']) self.cmd.run(results) self.assertTrue(self.hook._after_called)

commit_message:
Validate physical host reservation parameters

If min or max are missing or cannot be converted to integers, a Blazar
exception is returned.

Change-Id: I2f4b51a4e122345de221e51e6e977c12f5e2b867

commit_message:
Fix eventlet monkey patching

Eventlet monkey patching needs to be done as early as possible,
otherwise previous library imports are not patched correctly. This fixes
issues with concurrent requests receiving a 500 Internal Server Error
with a traceback including the following message:

    AttributeError: 'function' object has no attribute 'get'

This commit also adds a new Tempest scenario to test for this issue by
running concurrent requests against the Blazar service.

Change-Id: I9be2b6787a151d54ca9cce5c91fa9e11e727ce0b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar refs/changes/86/476986/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from threading import Thread MAX_CONCURRENCY = 10 # run lease list requests in parallel to check service concurrency def list_leases(self): lease_list = self.reservation_client.list_lease() self.assertEqual(lease_list, []) threads = [] for i in range(0, MAX_CONCURRENCY): t = Thread(target=list_leases) t.start() threads.append(t) for thread in threads: thread.join()

commit_message:
Add new --skip-existing option to kolla-build

This new option allows to skip images that are already present in the
docker cache.

Change-Id: I202c70864f8aa86abd882240beb7f6525963e625
Closes-Bug: #1694302
